newsitem.title: RUSSIA: CFM International, Rybinsk Motors plan JV.
newsitem.headline: CFM International, Rybinsk Motors plan JV.

text.p: French-based aero engines maker CFM International plans a joint venture with Russian engine manufacturer AO Rybinskiye Motory, CFM officials said.
CFM International is a joint venture of France's Snecma and U.S. General Electric Co.
The company supplies engines for Boeing and Airbus Industrie passenger and cargo planes.
Rolland Duclos, CFM engine sales director for the CIS, told a news conference on Wednesday that Rybinsk Motors had promising technical potential to produce the CFM-56 aircraft engine.
He said the joint venture would gradually work toward producing CFM-56 motors in the Russian city.
"Possibly we will begin with production of spare parts for these engines, but the final target will be complete assembly," Duclos said. "We have started work on this project."
